reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at No 4 B&B for two nights and we had really good enjoyable stay! As described by previous contributors, the house is stuffed full of quirky but interesting antiques, curios and artefacts, including a human skeleton dressed in a Victorian gown guarding the second floor landing. Stuart runs the B&B assisted by his very pleasant (and long-suffering?) wife Debbie and their family. Stuart is the most affable and generous host you could ever wish to meet; if you don’t enjoy a bit of banter mixed with serious conversation too, then this place is not for you. You are made to feel very welcome within minutes of arrival and you leave as firm friends.
reviews.title: Couldn't have asked for better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The B&B currently has two rooms available but we understand that Stuart is about to convert another room into guest accommodation with wet-room. We stayed in the ‘top room’ and it was extremely comfortable and filled with all sorts of curios. The rooms are en-suite and the only ‘criticism’ if I really had one, is that it didn’t have a shower – other readers may well prefer the bath (and attached hand-shower) but each to their own.
reviews.title: All you could want from a B & B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The B&B is located within a short and easy five-minute walk into the centre of Cromer, which is awash with pubs, cafes and eateries. Norwich is about a 40-minute drive away and the Broads about 25 minutes. We hired a day boat from a boatyard in Hoveton for a 6-hour mooch on the Broads and very good it was too. The boatyard (Fineway Leisure - [--]) is very easy to get to and their charges include fuel and insurance. It cost us £55 for the hire; the boat was a 7-seater and has a heater and cover for use in inclement weather.
reviews.title: Original and entertaining B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, we would thoroughly recommend No 4 B&B to anyone looking to stay in Cromer. Stuart is the perfect host (just don’t ask him any technical questions!!); nothing is too much for him and we came away after two days feeling we had known him for years. Go for it folks!
reviews.title: magical hidden gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the first B & B we have stayed in for a while - usually preferring modest hotels. But, having checked Trip Advisor reviews for Cromer we decided No 4 was the best option.
reviews.title: Unique and comfortable with the friendliest of hosts!

reviews.text: My better-half & I had the pleasure of staying at No. 4 over the weekend of 25 to 27 June 2010 having booked the B&B on the strength of the positive Tripadvisor reviews. Without wishing to repeat all of the good words said by other reviewers I would highlight the following:
reviews.title: The Butch & Bob Show

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is ideal; it’s 5 minutes stroll from the centre of the attractions and yet the B&B is on a very quiet residential street so you’re guaranteed a blissful night’s sleep.
reviews.title: Good stuff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The accommodation is excellent; it’s clean, well maintained and full of character - on one stairwell you’ll find a skeleton in a dress with its hand on an antique telephone, its one of the most left-field things I’ve yet witnessed in a B&B!.
reviews.title: A Treasure of a House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stuart is a very accommodating & professional host; this is a family home and you’re made to feel one of the family. Whilst I’d usually baulk at the idea of one large communal dining table at breakfast; here with Stuart entertaining and pleasant, engaging fellow guests breakfast became a leisurely, conversation-filled event. Breakfast time was superb.
reviews.title: Like stepping back in time

reviews.text: Much has been said about the dogs & cats in the house but when you meet them you’ll realise why they’re raved about. Butch is the size of a go-go hamster and moves like a tornado and the old-chap Bob is the canine equivalent of Clive Dunn - either of them will be in the hallway waiting for you to make a fuss of them and every time it was a pleasure.
reviews.title: Like staying with Alice about to go through the looking glass

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at No4 for a weeken and it is honestly the most wonderful B&B I've ever stayed in!
reviews.title: On Cloud9 at No4

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The decor is warm and cosy, with lots of interesting nick-nacks and oddities. The room we stayed in was beautifully decorated with tons of character and everything you could possibly need - from bathrobes, books and DVD's to a safe and beach towels!
reviews.title: Perfect B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The ensuite bathroom is just as fabulous - roll top bath, heated towel-rail and loads of space - BLISS!
reviews.title: Charming B&B with fanastic host

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Cromer Rock and Chocolate bars on the pillows was a lovely touch!
reviews.title: What a wonderful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was absolutely wonderful - lots of choice although I recommend the Full English. Don't blame me if you need to undo that top button afterwards though...
reviews.title: 100% affordable luxury&comfort plus a little bit extra

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Number 4 for 3 nights and were overwhelmed with the generosity and consideration shown. Stuart was a warm, friendly, helpful host with a very good sense of humour and attention to detail. If you like somewhere that little bit different, personal and full of character then this B&B is for you.We were greeted on the drive, our luggage was carried in, we were shown around and presented with doughnuts and a comprehensive tea tray in our room. Each day our room was cleaned thoroughly and different sweets were left on our bed! The breakfast was delicious and the option to have more after you had finished was always there; Stuart made sure that we did not leave the room hungry! The B&B is in a great location and Stuart is very knowledgeable about the local area. We had some good laughs and felt welcome and looked after throughout. Perfect!
reviews.title: Warm, unique and down to earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went to Cromer for the weekend, had a great time at No4, it was a wonderful experience in a very interesting and relaxing setting. Convenient for the beach and central Cromer, lovely rooms, excellent breakfast. Service wonderful. Will definitely visit again and highly recommend to anyone. Ian and Lorraine.
reviews.title: Highly recommended, wonderful location, will go again.

reviews.text: Stopped here for a night and wished we could have stayed longer. All the write ups are true. This B&B is something special. From the extremely warm and cuddly Stuart to the amazing home and its contents, not forgetting the breakfast, huge and very tasty. Too big for me, when I commented that 'my eyes were bigger than my belly' (as i couldn't eat it all) I wont repeat what the host with the most said!
reviews.title: Lovely Experience
Is this the best B& B in the world...quite possibly!
reviews.text: Would tell everyone to stay here, but we may never get booked in again ourselves. So can we keep it as our little secret?

reviews.title: Friendliest B&B on the Planet
reviews.text: Unfortunately we stayed at Number 4 in unhappy circumstances, however, we were made to feel so welcome by Stuart and his family. When we arrived we were greeted warmly and shown to the top room which has been refurbished since the photos on the website were taken and is now even nicer. The B& B is also a family home and the warm and welcoming atmosphere is evident from the minute you step through the door.
